Sunday, 20 November, 2022

Rest

Simmering down is a challenge this week. I wake, daily before 6am, and jump straight into the day. My jump doesn‚Äôt land me in a personalized Instagram feed or a busy news site, but on a blank screen that waits eagerly as I type my 1,000 words of the morning. It‚Äôs another one of the Habits I picked up this autumn. Me, the darkness outside, and a soft light in the living room acquainting me with the day. It‚Äôs pleasing to meet myself, unfiltered.

What‚Äôs top of mind right now

  • Saw Hannah Gadsby‚Äôs Body of Work and had a brief, cogent crush on her
  • Saw a large number of Twitter folks join the much kinder Mastodon club
  • Thought about what Jon Bell shared about the user experiences of Twitter, and how important it is for me to remember that appreciating the difference between doing the right thing and doing the thing right is central to how I operate as a designer.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She's interested in humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking. She engages in mellow cultural and critical analysis, linking and tinkering on her personal website, zinzy.website .
